speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: SCENE X. Another part of the plains.

speaker: AGAMEMNON
text_entry: Enter AENEAS and Trojans

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Stand, ho! yet are we masters of the field:

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Never go home; here starve we out the night.

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Enter TROILUS

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Hector is slain.

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Hector! the gods forbid!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: He's dead; and at the murderer's horse's tail,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: In beastly sort, dragg'd through the shameful field.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Frown on, you heavens, effect your rage with speed!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Sit, gods, upon your thrones, and smile at Troy!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I say, at once let your brief plagues be mercy,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: And linger not our sure destructions on!

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: My lord, you do discomfort all the host!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: You understand me not that tell me so:

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I do not speak of flight, of fear, of death,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: But dare all imminence that gods and men

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Address their dangers in. Hector is gone:

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Who shall tell Priam so, or Hecuba?

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Let him that will a screech-owl aye be call'd,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Go in to Troy, and say there, Hector's dead:

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: There is a word will Priam turn to stone;

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Make wells and Niobes of the maids and wives,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Cold statues of the youth, and, in a word,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Scare Troy out of itself. But, march away:

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Hector is dead; there is no more to say.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Stay yet. You vile abominable tents,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Thus proudly pight upon our Phrygian plains,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Let Titan rise as early as he dare,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I'll through and through you! and, thou great-sized coward,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: No space of earth shall sunder our two hates:

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I'll haunt thee like a wicked conscience still,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: That mouldeth goblins swift as frenzy's thoughts.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Strike a free march to Troy! with comfort go:

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Hope of revenge shall hide our inward woe.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Exeunt AENEAS and Trojans

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: As TROILUS is going out, enter, from the other side, PANDARUS

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: But hear you, hear you!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Hence, broker-lackey! ignomy and shame

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Pursue thy life, and live aye with thy name!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: A goodly medicine for my aching bones! O world!

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: world! world! thus is the poor agent despised!

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: O traitors and bawds, how earnestly are you set

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: a-work, and how ill requited! why should our

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: endeavour be so loved and the performance so loathed?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: what verse for it? what instance for it? Let me see:

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Full merrily the humble-bee doth sing,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Till he hath lost his honey and his sting;

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: And being once subdued in armed tail,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Sweet honey and sweet notes together fail.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Good traders in the flesh, set this in your

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: painted cloths.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: As many as be here of pander's hall,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Your eyes, half out, weep out at Pandar's fall;

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Or if you cannot weep, yet give some groans,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Though not for me, yet for your aching bones.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Brethren and sisters of the hold-door trade,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Some two months hence my will shall here be made:

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: It should be now, but that my fear is this,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Some galled goose of Winchester would hiss:

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Till then I'll sweat and seek about for eases,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: And at that time bequeathe you my diseases.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Exit
